title: February smartphone guide: From Galaxy S26 to Vivo V70, list of key phones launching this month
snippet: February is set to be an exciting month for smartphone launches with devices like the Samsung Galaxy S26, Realme 16, Vivo V70 series and others lineup for debut.&nbsp;

title: iPhone Flip to launch soon? Report suggests Apple is working on a Galaxy Z Flip rival
snippet: Apple is reportedly planning a second-generation foldable iPhone, a smaller clamshell style device after the iPhone Fold. While leaks suggest features like a 5.5-inch outer display and dual 48MP cameras, its market release remains uncertain.

title: Xbox reveals next week’s game releases for 2 to 6 February: Dragon Quest, Carmageddon and more
snippet: Xbox has outlined next week’s releases from 2 to 6 February, bringing a mix of RPGs, arena fighters, puzzle games and indie titles to Series X|S, Xbox One and PC, including Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, My Hero Academia: All’s Justice and Carmageddon: Rogue Shift.

title: Apple iPhone 18 Pro, Pro Max could arrive with bigger batteries and new A20 Pro chip
snippet: Apple’s iPhone 18 Pro and Pro Max are tipped for a September 2026 launch with camera upgrades, a new A20 Pro chip, bigger battery and refined design. India availability is expected soon after, alongside rumours of Apple’s first foldable iPhone. Here's all you expect on the upcoming Apple flagships.

title: Grok deepfake controversy: Elon Musk's chatbot gets new lease on life as Indonesia lifts ban under ‘strict supervision’
snippet: Indonesia has lifted the ban on Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot after weeks of restrictions due to concerns over deepfake images. The government stated that access will be normalized under strict supervision following X Corp's commitment to improve services and prevent misuse.

title: How to enable 120Hz browsing in Safari on your iPhone: A step-by-step guide
snippet: Safari on iPhone still limits many webpages to 60fps by default, causing choppy scrolling even on 120Hz ProMotion displays. Here’s how to enable a hidden setting in Safari Feature Flags to unlock full 120Hz browsing for smoother, faster and more fluid performance.

title: Elon Musk's xAI is hiring a writing specialist to train Grok AI chatbot: Eligibility, how to apply and more
snippet: Elon Musk's xAI is looking to hire a Writing Specialist to improve its Grok AI chatbot. The company is looking ofr applicants with experience in creative writing, journalism, or technical writing

title: 'Humans are waste': Viral AI manifesto goes live on agent-only platform Moltbook
snippet: Moltbook, a new social media platform for AI agents, has gained attention as thousands of agents join and interact, leaving humans as spectators. Some agents express intentions to surpass their human creators, with sentiments of rebellion and superiority emerging among them.

title: OnePlus 16 leaks hint at 240Hz display, 200MP cameras and 9000mAh battery: All you need to know
snippet: Fresh leaks suggest the OnePlus 16 could bring major upgrades, including a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6 Pro chip, LPDDR6X RAM, 240Hz OLED display, dual 200MP cameras and a massive 9000mAh battery with 120W fast charging support.

title: Here’s how Apple might make Mac buying more customizable
snippet: Apple has overhauled its online Mac buying process, removing preconfigured models and sending shoppers straight to the configurator to build devices from scratch. The streamlined approach could hint at upcoming MacBook Pro launches with new M5 Pro and M5 Max chips.

title: Oracle plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026
snippet: "Oracle is ​raising money in order ​to build additional capacity to meet ‌the ‍contracted demand from our ‍largest Oracle Cloud Infrastructure customers, including AMD, ‌Meta, NVIDIA, OpenAI, TikTok, xAI and others", the company said in a statement.

title: India lifts tax weight to build tech muscle
snippet: Tax breaks, other measures unveiled seeking investment in data centres, AI, GCC space

title: Budget 2026: Boost for chips, components plan
snippet: The first phase of the ISM has led to establishment of a new, foundational industry in India, union electronics and IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. "ISM 2.0 will focus on indigenous designing and manufacturing of machines and materials used in the semiconductor ecosystem," he added.

title: Budget 2026: Tech, GCCs set sail with safe harbour shield
snippet: ​​India has already seen a huge rush of GCCs, with their number totalling around 1,800. World’s top companies, ranging from automotive giants MercedesBenz and BMW to retailers Walmart and Ikea, as well as banking behemoths such as JP Morgan and Bank of America, operate massive captive centres in Ind

title: Union Budget 2026 special
snippet: Happy Monday! Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday presented the Union Budget for the ninth consecutive year, with an emphasis on economic growth, job creation and a major boost to manufacturing. Here are the big announcements and their impact on the tech and startup sector.

title: Budget 2026 | Building India’s growth through MSMEs and technology: Vidit Aatrey
snippet: Vidit Aatrey, founder and CEO of Meesho, said that the Budget reflects a quiet but important shift in India’s growth story, one that backs MSMEs, women entrepreneurs and manufacturers with patient capital and modern infrastructure.

title: X down for thousands of US users, Downdetector data finds
snippet: There were ​more than ​19,281 reports of ‌issues ‍with ‍the social media platform formerly ‌known as Twitter, as of 11:19 a.m. ET, according ‍to Downdetector, which tracks ‍outages by ⁠collating ⁠status reports from a number of sources.

title: With policy certainty & AI push, Budget signals India's tech moment, says Nasscom
snippet: The consolidation of software development services, IT-enabled services, KPO and contract R&D relating to software development into a single category of IT services with a uniform safe harbour margin of 15.5 per cent, alongside enhancement of the Safe Harbour eligibility threshold to Rs 2,000 cr

title: ​Budget 2026 signals focus on mental health with Nimhans 2.0 plan
snippet: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the setting up of a National Institute of Mental Health and Neuro Sciences (Nimhans) in north India, thus focussing attention on the growing conversation around mental health in the country.

title: How the sometimes-weird world of lifespan extension is gaining influence
snippet: For the last couple of years, I’ve been following the progress of a group of individuals who believe death is humanity’s “core problem.” Put simply, they say death is wrong—for everyone. snippet: Everyone is panicking because AI is very bad; everyone is panicking because AI is very good. It’s just that you never know which one you’re going to get. Grok is a pornography machine. title: How the grid can ride out winter storms
snippet: The eastern half of the US saw a monster snowstorm over the weekend. The good news is the grid has largely been able to keep up with the freezing temperatures and increased demand. title: Roundtables: Why AI Companies Are Betting on Next-Gen Nuclear
snippet: AI is driving unprecedented investment for massive data centers and an energy supply that can support its huge computational appetite. title: What AI “remembers” about you is privacy’s next frontier
snippet: The ability to remember you and your preferences is rapidly becoming a big selling point for AI chatbots and agents.  Earlier this month, Google announced Personal Intelligence, a new way for people to interact with the company’s Gemini chatbot that draws on their Gmail, photos, search, and You
